==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|いち|k1=いっ|すん|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=いっすん}} compound {{m|zh|一寸|tr=yit tshwon<sup>H</sup>|lit=one thumb, one inch}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|いっすん|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いっすん}}

# one ''sun'': a unit of length equivalent to a tenth of a {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku|pos=traditional Japanese foot as a unit of length}}, or approximately 3.03 centimeters
# a short amount of time, distance, or mass

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|一寸先|いっすん さき}}: just a little bit ahead, just a moment in the future
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|一寸先は闇|いっすん さき は やみ}}: “just a moment in the future is darkness” → the future is unknowable
* {{ja-r|一寸の光陰軽んずべからず|いっすん の こういん かろんず べからず}}: “a moment of light and dark should not be taken lightly” → every moment is precious
* {{ja-r|一寸の虫にも五分の魂|いっすん の むし に も ごぶ の たましい}}: “even a bug only an inch long is half [full of] soul” → even the smallest is worthy of respect
* {{ja-r|一寸下は地獄|いっすん した は じごく}}: “an inch below is hell” → an allusion to the dangers of being on a boat, where only an inch of wood is between oneself and the deep ocean
* {{ja-r|一寸延びれば尋延びる|いっすん の びれば ひろ のびる}}: “if it'll stretch an inch, it'll stretch for six feet” → if one can just get past the hardest part, the rest is relatively easy
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
From {{m|ja|ちっと|tr=chitto}}, itself a [[geminate]]d [[emphatic]] form of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ちょっと}} {{m|ja|ちと|tr=chito}}, originally composed of {{m|ja|ち|tr=chi||small|pos=not used in isolation; cognate with the ''chi'' in {{m|ja|小さい}} ''chīsai''}} + {{m|ja|と|tr=to|pos=adverbial particle}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ちょっと|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR||acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|ちょっと}}

# [[slightly]], [[a little]], [[a bit]]
# {{n-g|an indirect expression of refusal}}

=====Usage notes=====
Usually spelled in [[hiragana]], as {{m|ja|ちょっと}}.
